subject: unsubscribe
messageBody:
Steven Taschuk wrote:

> Quoth Anantha Lakshmi:
> > [...] I've created a TestSuite, which contains
> > sequence of Tests. I want to find out the "Time Taken
> > for each Test case in a Test suite" while running the
> > Test Suite. [...]
>
> Ant's <junit> task does this, with <formatter type='plain'/>.
>
> If you don't want to use Ant, it seems to me you can write the
> functionality yourself with not so much work. Something like this:
>
> 1. If you're writing your own implementations of Test
> (instead of, say, using TestCases), then make sure
> they call TestResult.startTest() and .endTest()
> in their run() methods.
>
> 2. Subclass java.textui.TestRunner, overriding the
> protected method createTestResult(); something like
>
> protected TestResult createTestResult() {
> TestResult result = super.createTestResult();
> result.addTestListener( new TimingTestListener() );
> return result;
> }
>
> 3. Write the TimingTestListener; a trivial version:
>
> public class TimingTestListener implements TestListener {
> private long start;
> public void startTest( Test test ) {
> start = new Date().getTime();
> }
> public void endTest( Test test ) {
> System.out.println( test.toString() + ": "
> + (new Date().getTime() - start)
> + "ms" );
> }
> // ... the rest of the TestListener interface ...
> }
>
> And that would be it. I haven't tested this, it's just off the
> top of my head, and I don't actually know what I'm talking about,
> so I invite comments and corrections.
>
> (One obvious point: what TimingTestListener should actually do is
> accumulate the results and provide methods for retrieving the
> information later. Also you might want to think about the
> possibility that your tests might someday be run concurrently in
> multiple threads, with one TestResult -- and hence one
> TimingTestListener -- shared among all those threads. The
> implementation suggested above would fail miserably in such a
> scenario.)
>
>
> To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
> junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
>
>
> Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
